entry.title: Tropical Storm Chris (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tropical Storm Chris (pictured) in July 2024 caused bodies of water to overflow in Ciudad Madero, Mexico, resulting in a crocodile sighting at a beach?

entry.title: Metropolitan Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when New York City's Metropolitan Club was established, there was another Metropolitan Club two city blocks away?

entry.title: William Pope (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William Pope, an Anglican deacon, was a follower of John Henry Newman and like him became a Roman Catholic priest?

entry.title: a bootleg album (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a bootleg album of Jai Paul's unreleased music was named as one of the best of 2013 by several music publications?

entry.title: Aracy Amaral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a historian lamented the lack of English-language translations for the work of Aracy Amaral despite it being "a vital reference for the study of art history in Brazil"?

entry.title: Auckland meteorite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Auckland meteorite crashed through the roof of a house in New Zealand?

entry.title: Rachel Scott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rachel Scott reported live during the January 6 United States Capitol attack in her first week as ABC News' White House correspondent?

entry.title: Nan Oo Pagoda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Nan Oo Pagoda is classified as a double encased stupa as it envelops a smaller stupa?

entry.title: Poetry for Neanderthals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the creators of Poetry for Neanderthals faced difficulties during its release because they needed a way to manufacture inflatable clubs?
